docs.summary:
Provides basic functionality for all Wix objects, including objects
 that are not [elements]($w.Element.html).
description: `Node` is a mixin that provides basic properties and functions for all Wix objects on the page, including objects
[Mixins](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-about-mixins) provide functionality that other elements can inherit and use.
Mixins are not elements. You cannot add mixins to a page in the Editor like other `$w` elements, and mixins are not meant to be used directly
For example, you would not write code like this, because it is out of context:

docs.summary: Indicates if an element appears on all pages or only on the current page.
description: If `global` is `true`, the element appears on all pages.
If `global` is `false`, the element only appears on the current page.

examples.title: Get whether an element is displayed on all pages

description: The ID is the element's unique identifier. It is used when selecting
An element's `id` is set in the Editor using the [Properties panel](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-do-i-use-the-properties-panel).
Some elements can contain other elements. This occurs when you drag
an element onto a container element. The container is the `parent` of
[`Footer`]($w.Footer.html) are top-level elements and have no parent.

examples.title: Get the parent element and the parent's ID

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the scroll is complete.

docs.summary: Scrolls the page to the top of the element using an animation.
description: The `scrollTo()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
animated scroll is complete and the element is in view.
To scroll to a specific location on the page, see the `wix-window`
scroll directly to an element, and also disable the animation.
To get the coordinates for scrolling, display the Wix Editor Toolbar. In the Editor,
move the cursor to the top-left pixel where you want the page to scroll to. The **X**
and **Y** axis **Position** values show the coordinates.
> + You can't call the `scrollTo()` function on an element inside a repeater.

> + To use `scrollTo()` with a header element, the [Header Scroll Setting](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-changing-the-header-scroll-settings) must be set to **Scrolls with site**. To scroll to the header with other settings, use the `wix-window` [`scrollTo()`](wix-window.html#scrollTo) function.

examples.title: Scroll the page to an element
Scroll the page to an element and log a message when done
